p: Stokes Raman scattering is generated when a molecule gets excited from the ground state to a virtual energy state and then relaxes into a vibrational excited state [ 29]. Anti-stokes Raman scattering is defined when a molecule is already in an elevated vibrational energy state and reaches to its ground state after scattering [ 41]. In order to exhibit the Raman effect, the amount of deformation of the electron cloud or the molecular changes in polarizability is required with respect to the vibrational coordinate [ 42]. The change in the intensity of the Raman scattering can be determined by the change in the amount of polarizability, and the vibrational level is equal to the Raman shift.
